intro: Scleranthus canescens, commonly known as the hoary cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and small, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is often found in temperate climates. It produces capsules that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Scleranthus canescens is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
